questions.question: ("Golden  Glass"/RL.8.1) -Which sentence best supports the idea that Ted is a dynamic character?

choices.answer: "Ted woke up to see the stained glass full of light."
"Ted was taking a makeup course and one in stained glass."
"In a few days he'd be inside, and he wouldn't mind at all."
"Ted hadn't seen his father in nearly four years..."

questions.question: (RL.8.1) At the beginning of the story, in lines 1-5, the narrator infers that Ted is guarded and cautious.
("Home"/RL.8.3) - Which line most supports the conclusion that the home is deeply tied to the family's identity?

choices.answer: "The could not tell a thing from the way Papa was walking..."
"She knew, from the way they looked at her, that this had been a mistake."
" 'It's just going to kill Papa!' burst out Maud Martha.' "

questions.question: ("The Bet"/RL.8.3) - The dialogue between the banker and the lawyer in Part 1 reveals that the banker is rational.
("The Bet"/ W.3.d) - The lawyer claims that desire is a prisoner's "chief foe," which precisely means "a supporter."
